corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

extent.value: in 5 record cartons and 2 manuscript boxes

abstract.value: Time's Up is a New York City environmentalist organization whose principal activity is the promotion of bicycle riding and the rights of cyclists through its Critical Mass campaigns. This collection consists of photographs, ephemera, and clippings related to Time's Up environmental organizing in New York City. These documents include posters, pamphlets, zines, flyers, and events calendars created to promote Critical Mass demonstrations and other acts of protest, events and celebrations, and fundraisers for Time's Up. They also include several binders containing local articles related to bike safety, the construction of bike lanes, and cycling events.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Time's Up Records; TAM 522; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

Donated by Dominic (Bill) Di Paola on behalf of Time's Up in 2009; additional materials were donated in 2010, 2011, and 2016  The accession numbers associated with this collection are 2009.094, 2010.005, 2010.079, 2011.007, and 2016.026.
Time's Up is a New York City environmentalist organization whose principal activity is the promotion of bicycle riding and the rights of cyclists through its Critical Mass campaigns.

This collection consists of materials created and collected by Time's Up in the course of their environmental activism. Materials includes posters, pamphlets, zines, flyers, and event calendars created to promote the organization's events and fundraisers, with particular emphasis on Critical Mass demonstrations and other acts of protest. The collection also includes several binders containing local articles related to bike safety, the construction of bike lanes, and cycling events.

The first Reclaim The Streets in New York city in 1998, Astor Place and Broadway. Time's Up bicycle repair workshops, one of Simon teaching at Time's Up's Brooklyn space, and two of Susan teaching women-only class in Time's Up's Manhattan Space. 2 Calendars: Monthly calendars including garden clean-ups, bicycle rides, educational workshops, bike rides. United States District Court, Rebecca BRAY, plaintiffs; against New-York City Legal folders containing press releases, letter from the City of New York Police Department to Time's Up threatening to ticket or arrest bicyclists New York Times article backed up with photographs from Time's Up of the police caught stealing bicycles. This incident then became the Bray case. 2016 Donation1993-2012567Scope and Content Note

This donation consists of ten binders of clippings related to Time's Up activities in New York City.The binders are grouped by year, and contain articles from local New York City publications like the Village Voice, Time Out New York, and the New York Times about events and news related to environmental issues in the city. The bulk of the articles relate to bike safety, construction of bike lanes, Critical Mass demonstrations, and cycling events.
